alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 29 at 12:09PM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Utah... The Lower Weber River At Plain City affecting Northern Wasatch Front zone. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Weber River...including Plain City...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...The Lower Weber River At Plain City. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City, affecting local farmland adjacent to the Weber River. At 28.0 feet, flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City. Additional flooding may occur if levee system fails. Homes adjacent to the Weber River near Plain City will receive flood damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage is forecast to be reached Monday evening, and the river is forecast to peak at 27.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM MDT.
